fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, Consumers, Education and training, Business and Industry, Taxation, Single market, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: - Financial reporting & accounting, including IFRS endorsement - Capital Markets Union - Tax policy, including issues related to the role of intermediaries -Public sector finances, including measures relating to public sector accounting standards (IPSAS/EPSAS) - Audit policy, including implementation of Audit Regulation and Audit Directive - Single Market issues, including actions from the Commission Single Market Strategy - Brexit negotiations. As well as developments in the financial services / corporate governance / company law / digital policy / sustainability / enterprise / professional requirements & skills areas.
organisation_name: Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
ICAEW is a member of a number of bodies and contributes to the development of policy positions within such bodies - although only views expressed directly by ICAEW should be attributed to ICAEW.  
 
Those bodies with a focus on issues also dealt with at EU level include: Accountancy Europe / Confédération Fiscale Européenne / British Chambers of Commerce in Belgium / Consultative Committee of Accountancy Bodies / the Common Content Project / the European Council of the Liberal Professions (via the UK Inter-Professional Group) / Politico PRO / European Services Forum (ESF). 
 
ICAEW is also a member of a number of international bodies such as the Global Accounting Alliance, Chartered Accountants Worldwide and the International Federation of Accountants. 
 
ICAEW currently hosts the Natural Capital Coalition.
goals__remit: ICAEW operates under a Royal Charter, working in the public interest. Its regulation of its members, in particular its responsibilities in respect of auditors, is overseen by the UK Financial Reporting Council. As a world leading professional accountancy body, ICAEW provides leadership and practical support to over 149,000 members around the world, working with governments, regulators and industry to ensure the highest standards are maintained. Our members provide financial knowledge and guidance based on the highest technical and ethical standards. We develop and support individuals, organisations and communities to help them achieve long-term, sustainable economic value.
